titlestmt.titleproper: National Committee on United States-China Relations records, Audiovisual Materials, Record Group 10
A Guide to the National Committee on United States-China Relations records, Audiovisual Materials, Record Group 10 FA1318

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-04-25 00:03:13 -0400.

did.unittitle: National Committee on United States-China Relations records, Audiovisual Materials, Record Group 10

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: National Committee on United States-China Relations

physdesc.extent: 7 record storage boxes, 181 Audio reels, 49 videos

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series: Series 1: Audio recordings. Series 2: Video recordings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audiovisual recordings of conferences, seminars, symposiums, and NCUSCR programs, events and exhanges.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

did.unittitle: Audio Recordings
did.materialspec: All items are 1/4 inch audio tape unless otherwise noted.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 1: Audio Recordings is arranged in 5 subseries as follows:
Subseries C: Conferences, Seminars and Symposiums;

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Tapes have been minimally arranged chronologically by date of creation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Interviews, conferences, events, panel discussions, and presentation.

odd.head: General
odd.p: All titles are currently based on original container annotations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Address on the cultural revolution, probably given in Detroit or Ann Arbor.

did.unittitle: Harald Munthe-Kaas - NCUSCR Community Leaders Seminar

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Introduction by Cecil Thomas. Address given in New York to 40 community leaders, representing national organizations.

did.unittitle: China Seminar for Southern Journalists - Tape 1 of 5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Atlanta (Regional Journalists seminar). Richard Solomon, "The Cultural Revolution"; Mark Gayn, "China, A First-Hand View."

did.unittitle: China Seminar for Southern Journalists - Tape 2 of 5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Atlanta (Regional Journalists seminar). Roy Hofheinz, "Social Change and Communist Power"; discussion period; evening roundtable on Public Health (Dr. Kenneth Thomson and others).

did.unittitle: China Seminar for Southern Journalists - Tape 3 of 5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Atlanta (Regional Journalists seminar). Conclusion of Public Health discussion; Jurgen Domes, "The Cultural Revolution and the Army"; Harold Hinton, "Development of China's Foreign Policy"; Dwight Perkins, "China's Economic Development and Military Potential."

did.unittitle: China Seminar for Southern Journalists - Tape 4 of 5
did.physdesc: 69 minutes (followed by 125 minutes of blank recording).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Atlanta (Regional Journalists seminar). Conclusion of Dwight Perkins discussion; Richard Walker, "The Nature of CCP Social Control."

did.unittitle: China Seminar for Southern Journalists - Tape 5 of 5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Atlanta (Regional Journalists seminar). Loren Fessler, "Problems Facing the Western Journalist Reporting from Hong Kong"; Donald Klein, round table chair, "Communicating about China: An Exchange on Problems Confronting Scholars and Journalists." Presentation by Paul Kreisberg ("United States-China Relations: Present Problems and Future Prospects") not on this recording.

did.unittitle: China Seminar for Southern Journalists - Banquet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Atlanta (Regional Journalists seminar). Address by Robert Scalapino on "China in Historical Perspective."

did.unittitle: Senatorial Assistants Program - Address by Lt. Gen. Wang Sheng and Professor Cheng Hsueh-chia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Address (in Chinese, with English translation) entitled, "An Analysis of the Chinese Communist Army: A View from Taiwan." Luncheon program at the Capital Hill Hotel, Washington, DC.

did.unittitle: David Mozingo - Foundation Seminar, New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Continuing seminar on China, sponsored by the Christopher Reynolds Foundation and the NCUSCR. Mozingo spoke on the Balance of Power in Asia.

did.unittitle: Robert Scalapino Views on China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inteview by Carolyn Lewis, on behalf of the League of Women Voters, Washington, DC, for the program "Perspective."
The tape recording, labeled "Mainland China," begins in mid-response.

did.unittitle: Roundtable on Prospects and Problems of Developing Relations with China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Untitled and unlabeled tape recording, presumably of the National Committee's Roundtable meeting on the Prospects and Problems of Developing Relations with China, 1971 January 22-23. This recording appears to cover the full day of sessions on Friday, January 22. See also separate recordings for Friday A.M. and Friday P.M. (AV 9034 and AV 9035). Files AV 9033 and AV 9032 record the second day's discussions (on Saturday, January 23), including a closing summation that was open to the public. Document files pertaining to this roundtable are found in the NCUSCR records, RG 4, FA1186, Series 5, box 19, folders 146-147; and boxes 56-57, folders 546-552.

did.unittitle: Roundtable on Prospects and Problems of Developing Relations with China (Friday A.M.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape recording labeled only "Friday A.M.," presumably of the National Committee's Roundtable meeting on the Prospects and Problems of Developing Relations with China, 1971 January 22.

See also AV 9031, which appears to cover the full day of sessions on Friday, January 22, and a separate recording for Friday P.M. (AV 9035). See also files AV 9033 and AV 9032, which appear to record the second day's discussions (on Saturday, January 23).
Document files pertaining to this roundtable are found in the NCUSCR records, RG 4, FA1186, Series 5, box 19, folders 146-147; and boxes 56-57, folders 546-552.

did.unittitle: Roundtable on Prospects and Problems of Developing Relations with China (Friday P.M.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape recording labeled only "Friday P.M.," presumably of the National Committee's Roundtable meeting on the Prospects and Problems of Developing Relations with China, 1971 January 22.

See also AV 9031, which appears to cover the full day of sessions on Friday, January 22, and a separate recording for Friday A.M. (AV 9034). See also files AV 9033 and AV 9032, which appear to record the second day's discussions (on Saturday, January 23).
Document files pertaining to this roundtable are found in the NCUSCR records, RG 4, FA1186, Series 5, box 19, folders 146-147; and boxes 56-57, folders 546-552.

did.unittitle: Roundtable on Prospects and Problems of Developing Relations with China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape recording labeled "Sat X Press," presumably covering the second day of the National Committee's Roundtable meeting on the Prospects and Problems of Developing Relations with China, 1971 January 23. The reference to "Press" may refer to the public summary session that closed the conference.
See also file AV 9032 ("Press Conference") which appears to record the conference summation and closing discussions on Saturday, January 23.
See also AV 9031, which appears to cover the full day of sessions on Friday, January 22; and AV 9034 and AV 9035, which are separate recordings for Friday AM. and P.M.
Document files pertaining to this roundtable are found in the NCUSCR records, RG 4, FA1186, Series 5, box 19, folders 146-147; and boxes 56-57, folders 546-552.

did.physdesc: 56 minutes. There is a brief interruption in the recording at around 46 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1 of 1. Dinner in honor of Premier Zhu Rongji, in Washington, DC. Cosponsored by the NCUSCR, the America-China Society, the Asia Society, the Committee of 100, the Council on Foreign Relations, the U. S. - China Policy Foundation, and the U. S. Chamber of Commerce. Address delivered in Chinese, with translation into English.
The recording cuts off abruptly at the end (during a question and answer period).

Video Recordings

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audiovisual recordings of conferences, seminars, symposiums, and NCUSCR programs, events and exhanges. Some Chinese films and television broadcasts are also included.

did.unittitle: Scholar Orientation Program Reunion, Beijing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reunion program and reception for SOP alumni in Beijing and Shanghai. A reunion in China was originally planned for late 1995, but it was postponed until June 1996.

did.unittitle: Life in Tibet

did.unittitle: The Panchen Lama's Last Days

did.unittitle: Ussuri Project - Land Use Planning Delegation to the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Joint delegation from China and Russia, 1994 July 30 - August 14. Meetings and discussion with U.S. delegates at Lake Placid, NY; visits.
Video in Chinese and some English. Tape was labeled "Ussuri Team to the U.S., 1994, shot by Dang Dexian."

did.unittitle: Ussuri Project - Steering Committee First Meeting, Harbin

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Loud static/hiss in audio track makes sound unintelligible. At around 35 minutes, the video briefly plays at too fast a speed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Steering Committee First Meeting, Ussuri River Watershed Sustainable Land Use Joint Project among China, Russia, and the United States. Meeting in Harbin, China. U.S. delegation included David M. Lampton, Douglas Murray, and George Davis.

Chinese Footage: Ping Pong - 71 China 72 US

processinfo.p: Same content as AV 11946, 11951 and 11947. Image and sound quality have not been compared.

did.unittitle: Chinese Table Tennis Delegation in U.S.A.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chinese ping pong team U.S. visit (Detroit, Williamsburg, Washingtion, DC, New York, Memphis, Los Angeles, and San Francisco). In English. Film produced by the Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Studio of the PRC, September 1972.

did.unittitle: ABC-TV Wide World of Sports: Ping Pong Exchange

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chinese table tennis team in Detroit. Footage of games and visits. The program recording includes commercials and other sports coverage.
